title: MS AccessCurDir()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessCurDir()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
CurDir()
CurDir("D")
Result:
C:\Documents and Settings\user\My Documents
D:\
Definition and Usage
The CurDir() function returns the full path for a 
specified drive.
Syntax
CurDir(
drive
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
drive
Optional. The drive to return the full path for. If omitted, the current drive 
    is used
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessCurDir()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessCurDir()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessCurDir()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
